definition: see 磅秤 scale/platform balance/(loanword) pound (unit of weight, about 454 grams)

sentences.english: You can make solar ovens from boxes or heavy paper.
sentences.chinese: 您可以從箱子或重磅紙太陽竈。

sentences.english: As they finished breakfast, Dorothy dropped her bombshell .
sentences.chinese: 喫罷早飯，多蘿西投下了她的重磅炸彈。

sentences.english: Thick elastic jeans, wear-resistant and dirt-proof, are good companion for traveling.
sentences.chinese: 重磅彈力牛仔褲，耐磨耐髒，出差好搭檔。

sentences.english: They also have their record signing Asamoah Gyan who played in the World Cup.
sentences.chinese: 他們還有他們的重磅級新援阿薩莫阿，他踢了世界盃。

sentences.english: Each stack of sheets is combined with a backer sheet of chipboard or heavy paper.
sentences.chinese: 每個表的堆棧是結合靠山表的硬紙板或重磅紙。

sentences.english: The covers were of heavy weight, buff-coloured calendered paper with two holes punched in the edges.
sentences.chinese: 封面和封底是重磅的米色道林紙，邊上打了兩個眼。

sentences.english: “He knew that this was a holy-shit piece of film,” Amos told me.
sentences.chinese: 他知道這將是一部狗屁重磅的紀錄片。

sentences.english: This heavily Asian program is designed to promote art-house cinema with a clear auteur inclination.
sentences.chinese: 這次的亞洲重磅計劃意在推廣導演們的藝術電影。

sentences.english: The covers is heavy beige Dowling, have two holes with edge.
sentences.chinese: 封面和封底是重磅的米色道林紙，邊上打了兩個眼。

definition: on the eve of/to be about to/to be on the verge of
see 磅秤 scale/platform balance/(loanword) pound (unit of weight, about 454 grams)
to invade/(of a storm etc) to strike/to hit
to put effort into (work, farming, writing etc)/a masterpiece
to push out/to release/to launch/to publish/to recommend
(Internet slang) time after time/again and again and again
to continue/to follow after/to go on with/to succeed/to inherit/then/afterwards

to strike a pose (Chinese opera)/(fig.) to make a public appearance/to come out in public (revealing one's true personality, opinions etc)/(of a product) to appear on the market or at a trade show etc
